summary: The text discusses the establishment and functions of the Nepal Lalitkala Pragya Pratisthan Act of 2064, which aims to protect and promote various forms of art in Nepal. The Act establishes the central office in Kathmandu and allows for the opening of branches in different locations as needed. It also outlines the roles and responsibilities of the organization in promoting and preserving art and culture in the country.

summary: The text discusses the regulations related to the formation, groups, categories, and appointments within the Nepal Forest Service, as published in the Nepal Gazette in 2051. It also mentions the amendments made in 2073 and 2080. The regulations outline the structure, qualifications, and positions within the service, including various categories and positions based on educational qualifications and expertise. The document also specifies the different categories of positions within the service and the criteria for appointment to those positions.
